pageTitle: SANTOS LTD (STO:Australian Stock Exchange Ltd): Stock Quote & Company Profile - Businessweek
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {11029=Santos Limited announced earnings results and production results for the second quarter and six months ended June 30, 2015. For the quarter, the company reported total capital expenditure of AUD 366 million against AUD 1,042 million a year ago. Sales revenue was AUD 786 million against AUD 974 million a year ago, affected by the lower realized oil price, partially offset by higher domestic gas prices and a weaker Australian dollar. For the six months, the company reported total capital expenditure of AUD 932 million against AUD 1,986 million a year ago. Sales revenue was AUD 1,611 million against AUD 1,887 million a year ago. For the second quarter production of 14.3 million barrels of oil equivalent (mmboe) and sales volumes of 15.7 mmboe were 12% and 4% higher than the corresponding quarter. For the six months, production was 28.3 mmboe against 25 mmboe a year ago. The company announced that for the year 2015, it expects production is to be in the range between from 57 mmboe to 64 mmboe, depreciation, depletion & amortization expense is to be in the range between from AUD 14.2 to AUD 14.6 per boe, Capital expenditure (including exploration and evaluation) is to be AUD 2 billion., 4792=Santos Limited explores for, develops, produces, transports, and markets hydrocarbons in Australia and internationally. The company produces natural gas, ethane, liquefied gas, crude oil, condensate, naphtha, and liquefied petroleum gas. It has producing assets in Papua New Guinea, Indonesia, and Vietnam; and exploration assets in Malaysia and Bangladesh. It also transports crude oil by pipeline. As of December 31, 2014, the company had total proved plus probable reserves of 1,245 million barrels of oil equivalent. Santos Limited was founded in 1954 and is headquartered in Adelaide, Australia.}
